description: A lighter summertime rendition of minestrone soup made for cool September evenings.
headline: Orzo Minestrone with Fresh Corn, Zucchini, and Pesto

HowtoTip.text: Vegan Upgrade: You can make this with prepared vegan pesto, or leave the pesto out entirely and add a couple of grated garlic cloves, a pinch of salt, and 1/2 cup finely chopped basil to the tomatoes in Step 3.Reprinted from Dinner in One: Exceptional & Easy One-Pan Meals. name: Orzo Minestrone with Fresh Corn, Zucchini, and Pesto
recipeIngredient: 2 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, divided, more as needed
1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, more for serving
1 (14-ounce) can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
1 (28-ounce) can diced or whole plum tomatoes
1 cup corn kernels (either cut from one large fresh ear or frozen and thawed)
1/4 cup prepared pesto, more for serving
Torn fresh basil leaves, for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: In a soup pot, heat oil over medium-high heat. Stir in carrots, celery, and onions, 1 teaspoon salt, and pepper, and cook until softened, stirring frequently, about 5 minutes. Stir in zucchini, and garlic, and cook for another 1 minute.

Add beans, stock, canned tomatoes and their liquid, and remaining 1 1/2 teaspoon salt. (If using whole plum tomatoes, break them up with kitchen shears or squish them in your hands before adding to the pot.) Bring mixture to a simmer, then cover the pot and reduce heat to low. Simmer until vegetables are tender, 20 to 30 minutes. Stir in corn, and orzo, then return to a simmer. Simmer until orzo is nearly tender, 10 to 12 minutes. Taste and add salt if needed.
While soup is simmering, in a medium bowl, toss together the cherry tomatoes and pesto.

When the orzo is almost tender, add tomatoes and pesto to the pot and simmer for 1 to 2 minutes longer to heat the tomatoes through and finish cooking the orzo. Remove from heat and ladle soup into serving bowls. Serve topped with more pesto, parmesan, basil leaves, and lots of black pepper.
